titleStmt.title: G. R. Hughes to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2231

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Carlisle Ky
October 25th 1865
To his Excellency
Thos E Bramlett
Governor of Ky,
Dear Sir

There is a vacancy in the office of Justice of the Peace in District No. 3 in this (Nicholas) County, occassioned by the removal of James H. Barnett. Esq, And at the urgent solicitation of my neighbors in the District I have agreed to accept the appointment to fill said vacancy having heretofore acted as Justice in said District I would accept the appointment as a favor
We cordially recomend the appointment of G. R. Hughes as Justice of the Peace to fill the vacancy occasioned by the removal of Jas. H. Barnett, in District No. 3 in Nicholas County Ky.

Jno A Campbell Clk. Co. Ct,
John M. Chevis Clerk N C. Court
John McKee J. P. N. C.
Carlisle District
G A Fisher P. M. At Carlisle Ky
H. M. Stitt
Justice Peace
Nicholas Co
G R Hughes
apptd
31 Oct/65
